alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Lamoille; Western Franklin (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:03PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Lamoille, northwestern Orleans and southeastern Franklin Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 203 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Belvidere Center, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orleans, Waterville, Jay, Newport Town, Jay In Franklin County, Irasburg, Eden, Bakersfield, Westfield, Orleans Village, Newport Center, North Troy Village, Montgomery Center, Montgomery, Troy, Lowell, Belvidere Center, Belvidere, Coventry and Cambridge. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 161 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern and northwestern Vermont.
